org.csstudio.platform.securestore
Class SecureStore

java.lang.Object
  org.csstudio.platform.securestore.SecureStore

public final class SecureStore
extends java.lang.Object

Service that provides an encrypted store for login and other information.

Note that the secure store cannot guarantee that information stored in the store can be retrieved later. The information will, for example, become inaccessible if the user changes his password. The store is reset in this case. For clients using the secure store, this means that they must not assume that the store will always return previously stored information.

Author:
Anze Vodovnik, Joerg Rathlev

Method Detail

getInstance

public static SecureStore getInstance()
Singleton accessor for the secure store manager.

unlock

public boolean unlock(java.lang.String username,
                      java.lang.String password)
Attempts to unlock this store and load its data. This method must be called before the store can be used by clients. It is expected that this method is called by the plug-in that is responsible for the primary user login.

Parameters:
username - the username.
password - the user's password. This password is used to protect the secret key which is used to encrypt the information stored in this secure store.
Returns:
true if this store was successfully unlocked, false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if username is null or the empty string.

generateKey

private void generateKey()
                  throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
Sets the key used by this secure store to a newly generated key.

Throws:
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the algorithm is unavailable.

loadKeyStore

private java.security.KeyStore loadKeyStore(java.lang.String username,
                                            char[] password)
                                     throws java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                            java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                            java.security.cert.CertificateException
Returns the keystore for the specified user. If a keystore file exists, the keystore is loaded from that file, otherwise a new keystore is returned.

Parameters:
username - The username associated with the key store.
password - The password associated with the key store.
Returns:
the key store for the user.
Throws:
java.security.KeyStoreException - If there was an error with the key store.
java.security.cert.CertificateException
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - Thrown if the selected provider is not installed.

saveKeyStore

private void saveKeyStore(java.lang.String username,
                          char[] password,
                          java.security.KeyStore ks)
                   throws java.security.KeyStoreException,
                          java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                          java.security.cert.CertificateException
Saves a keystore to a file.

Parameters:
username - the username. This is used to determine the file name.
password - the password used to protect the keystore's integrity.
ks - the keystore.
Throws:
java.security.KeyStoreException
java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
java.security.cert.CertificateException

Parameters:
identifier - The identifier under which the object is stored.
value - The value of the object.

getObject

public java.lang.Object getObject(java.lang.String identifier)
Gets the object from the preferences store.

Parameters:
identifier - The identifier under which the object is stored.
Returns:
Returns the value of the object stored in the preferences.
